item.title: Is the new e-Privacy Regulation a threat to human rights? Exploring the implications of Tele2 and Watson.
item.description:
Matthew White, Ph.D candidate, Sheffield Hallam University Introduction This post follows up on a previous one from last Christmas, which discussed data retention in the context of the proposed Regulation on Privacy and Electronic Communications (e-Privacy Regs). The European Commission released the official version of the e-Privacy Regs on January 10, 2017. Like the leaked version, the official proposal does not have specific provisions for data retention (para 1.3). The proposal allows Member States to maintain or create their own data retention laws...

item.title: Is it an early Christmas gift or a disappointment? Examining data retention and the leaked ePrivacy Regulation.
item.description:
Matthew White, Ph.D candidate, Sheffield Hallam University The leak of a draft ePrivacy Regulation on December 12, 2016, has sparked discussions about its implications for data retention. This post will examine this aspect of the draft regulation. The Article 29 Data Protection Working Party (A29DPWP) had previously advised against introducing new European data retention requirements. This recommendation, reflecting concerns about the existing ePrivacy Directive’s allowance for national data retention regimes, is echoed in the leaked draft Regulation...
